summary: This document is an email chain from January 14, 2021, involving the Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program reaching out to law enforcement. The Administrator, Jordy, attempts to contact Special Agent Young and a Detective from the NYPD/NY FBI Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force to discuss the program, but is redirected by the Detective to Special Agent Young.

persons.name: Jordy
persons.role: Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, identifying as the Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, seeking to connect with law enforcement to discuss the program.

persons.name: Special Agent Young
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent referenced as the point of contact for the Administrator's inquiry regarding the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Detective
persons.role: NYPD Detective, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: A detective with the NYPD/NY FBI Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force (C20) who initially received the Administrator's request but redirected it to Special Agent Young.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator whose victims are the subject of the compensation program being administered.

connections.description: Jordy, as Program Administrator, is attempting to establish contact with Special Agent Young to discuss the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.
Jordy initially contacted the Detective, who then referred Jordy to Special Agent Young.
The Detective works with or is aware of Special Agent Young as part of the NY FBI Squad C20 task force and refers the Program Administrator to her.
Jordy administers a compensation program for the victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Outreach from Victims' Compensation Program Administrator
events.description: The Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program emails law enforcement to request a meeting to discuss the program.

keyFacts: The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program was an active, independent program in January 2021, established as a litigation-alternative to resolve victims' claims.
The Program Administrator was actively seeking to connect with law enforcement (specifically the NYPD/NY FBI Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force) regarding the program.
Law enforcement communication shows a referral protocol, with a Detective redirecting the Administrator's inquiry to a specific FBI Special Agent (Young).
The correspondence highlights the ongoing administrative and legal efforts to address the Epstein case well after his death.
